intro: Axinaea oblongifolia, commonly known as the long-leaf axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, which bloom during the wet season. Axinaea oblongifolia is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
